result.execSummary:
The defendant John Carlos Velazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Carlos Velazquez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Carlos Velazquez was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • John Carlos Velazquez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay DNA surcharge and DV assessments as to both counts. Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA and DV surcharges) by the end of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant of firearm, body armor, and voting restrictions.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: **10-06-2022/Judge Michelle A. Havas - Court orders probation term on count four is commuted to two years**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Carlos Velazquez

records.addlTxt: reflects court order signed 10-06-2022 commuting probation term on count four to two years
Order Commuting Probation Term, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 10, for review. spc
Letter from DOC seeking a review of the defendant's probation

CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 29. 
Defendant John Carlos Velazquez in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant John Carlos Velazquez in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 AND COUNT 4:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered the Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer on Count 1 DISMISSED, Count 3 DISMISSED OUTRIGHT, and COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional Statement made by C.G.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to Count 4; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

AS TO COUNT 4: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Count 1, with 63 days credit for time served.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school.
- Batterer's Intervention Program. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- No contact with C.G. or her children. 
- Pay DNA surcharge and DV assessments as to both counts.

Court DENIES request for expungement.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and DV surcharges) by the end of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised the defendant of firearm, body armor, and voting restrictions.  20 day appeal rights given. 

Filed:   Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
